case_title: Messrs Frigz Foods Sialkot Cantt vs Commissioner (Appeals) PRA, Lahore

accussed_details.name: Messrs Frigz Foods Sialkot Cantt
allegation: Non/short deposit of Punjab Sales Tax on franchise tax and restaurant services
Penalty for late deposit of Punjab Sales Tax

complaint_summary: The appellant was accused of failing to deposit Punjab Sales Tax on franchise tax and restaurant services, non-provision of records, late deposit of tax, and non-filing of returns for the tax period October 2012 to March 2014, amounting to Rs.3,072,320/- plus penalties and surcharges.
investigation_summary: The Additional Commissioner Enforcement-01 issued a show-cause notice on 17.08.2015 based on credible information and an ongoing investigation. Despite repeated requests, the appellant failed to provide requisite records or respond, leading to an assessment order on 28.08.2015.
judgment_summary: The tribunal set aside the impugned order passed by the Commissioner (Appeals) PRA Lahore, citing procedural lapses, lack of proper adjudication, and failure to address the appellant's contentions. The case was remanded for fresh adjudication with specific directions to address all grounds raised by the appellant.
legal_arguments: SCN issuance was illegal and without jurisdiction.
Impugned order was non-speaking and failed to address appellant's contentions.
Incorrect tax calculations and double taxation.
Penalty imposed without establishing mens rea or willful default.
statutes: Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012

words_and_phrases.Franchisee: Entity operating under a franchise agreement

summary_vector_notes: The case involves procedural lapses in tax adjudication under the Punjab Sales Tax framework. The tribunal remanded the case for fresh adjudication, emphasizing proper addressing of appellant's contentions and adherence to procedural rules.
